# Git Training

[![MIT Licensed](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg?style=flat-square)](./LICENSE)
[![Powered by Modus_Create](https://img.shields.io/badge/powered_by-Modus_Create-blue.svg?longCache=true&style=flat&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://moduscreate.com)

Training to get started with git basics.

# Setup
You can download Git here: [https://git-scm.com/downloads](https://git-scm.com/downloads), then check it with the following command:

```bash
git --version
```

# Commands

## Configuring name and email

```bash
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your@email.com"
```

## Initializing a repository

```bash
git init
```

## Checking status

```bash
git status
```

## Staging files

```bash
git add file.js file2.js
git add .
```

## Commits

To commit staged files:

```bash
git commit -m "Commit message"
```

To check commit history:

```bash
git log
```

## Branches

Create a new branch:

```bash
git branch <branch-name>
```

Switch to a branch:

```bash
git checkout <branch-name>
```

To create a new branch and switch to it at the same time:

```bash
git checkout -b <branch-name>
```

To merge the changes from a different branch into your current branch:

```bash
git merge <branch-name>
```

To delete a branch:

```bash
git branch -d <branch-name>
```
